plant_info.name: Yarrow
warnings: May cause allergic reaction in rare cases.
Use the essential oil only under professional supervision.

growth_info.grows_in: Grows wildly in temporate regions, in meadows and along verges.

uses_descriptions: Yarrow was used widely to heal wounds, and in Scotland a traditional wound ointment was made from Yarrow.
In Gynaecology, yarrow aids the menstrual cycle by reducing heavy menstrual bleeding and easing period pain.
Combined with other herbs, aids recovery from cold and flu

plant_adds_description_for.Infusion: Combine Yarrow with Elderflower & Peppermint, and infuse with a lid for up to 15 minutes. Drink hot or cold as a cold & flu aide.
plant_adds_description_for.Tincture: Prepare as a tincture. For indigestion, take 20 drops 3 times a day.
plant_adds_description_for.Essential oil: When prepared as an essential oil, Yarrow is often used by herbalists to treat Catarrh (mucous buildup)
plant_adds_description_for.Anti-inflammatory: Yarrow may aid liver inflammation, treat skin infections & signs of aging.
